Name: Inspect CSS animation
Description: Can I inspect CSS animations & keyframes using the devtools?
Author: @pankajparashar

Chrome.References:
[1] "Inspect animations", on Chrome Developers [Docs](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/css/animations/).  
[2] "How to inspect animations", by Google Chrome Developer on [YouTube](https://youtu.be/lVLzkleL_CE).
Chrome.Notes:
1. Open **Command** **Menu** (`Cmd+Shift+P` or `Ctrl+Shift+P`) > Run  "Show Animations" and press `Enter.`
2. Trigger the animation to record it on the timeline. Now you can use the buttons in the **Controls** section to adjust the replay speed of the animation.
3. Use the **Timeline** section to scrub the animation or jump to a specific point in animation. Use the **Details** section modify the timing & the delay of the animation.
Chrome.Name: Inspect CSS animation

Firefox.Notes: 1. Inspect the element which uses CSS animation. Click on the **Animations** pane next to the DOM tree in the side panel.
Firefox.Name: Inspect CSS animation

Safari.Name: Inspect CSS animation
Safari.Notes:
1. Open devtools > Open the "Timelines" tab > Ensure that "Media and Animations" is enabled in the left panel.
2. Now reload the page or trigger the animation to see the timeline in the bottom panel.
